feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued December 12 at 8:00PM AKST until December 13 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Central Inner Channels along the Mitkof Highway. * WHEN...Until 800 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. West winds up to 25 mph through Turnagain Arm may lower visibility to one half mile at times. * WHERE...Anchorage.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 3:13PM AKST until December 12 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE KLONDIKE HIGHWAY NEAR WHITE PASS... A wave of moisture is moving through the northern panhandle Tuesday. With cold air in place, moderate to heavy snow is expected to continue through late Tuesday evening near White Pass.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 2:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Two to Four Inches of Snow Through Wednesday Afternoon... A band of snow just east of Fairbanks as of 4:30am Tuesday will push back to the west over the area west of Fairbanks from Murphy Dome to Tanana to Cantwell early Tuesday afternoon. entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. * WHERE...Western Chippewa and Central Chippewa Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Wednesday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 7:52PM EST until December 13 at 7:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches, heaviest in northeastern Alger and northern Luce Counties. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph, locally up to 35 mph along the lakeshore.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 9:05PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN...SOUTHWESTERN POWDER RIVER...SOUTHERN ROSEBUD AND EASTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES... Patchy dense fog continues in the Sheridan area this evening as well as along I-90 to the Aberdeen Hill vicinity. Visibility is under a half mile locally. The dense fog is also expanding north into southern Rosebud County in Montana.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud
